SEARCH
Package sh.brane.rpc

Interface BraneMetrics

All Known Implementing Classes:
BraneMetrics.Noop
public interface BraneMetrics
Interface for collecting metrics from the Brane RPC layer.

Implementations can integrate with popular metrics libraries like Micrometer, Prometheus, or custom monitoring solutions. By default, a no-op implementation is used (noop()).

Usage: 


 BraneMetrics metrics = new MyMicrometerMetrics(meterRegistry);
 WebSocketProvider provider = WebSocketProvider.create(config);
 provider.setMetrics(metrics);

Thread Safety: Implementations must be thread-safe as methods may be called from multiple threads concurrently.

Since:
0.2.0

      Called when a request is started.
      Parameters:

    • onRequestTimeout

      Use onRequestTimeout(String, long) instead for better debugging context
      Called when a request times out.
      Parameters:
      method - the JSON-RPC method name

    • onRequestTimeout

      default void onRequestTimeout(String method, long requestId)
      Called when a request times out.

      This method provides the request ID for correlation with logs and other metrics. Use this to track which specific requests are timing out and correlate with server-side logs.

      Parameters:
      method - the JSON-RPC method name (e.g., "eth_call")
      requestId - the unique request ID for correlation with logs
      Since:
      0.5.0

    • onRequestFailed

      default void onRequestFailed(String method, Throwable error)
      Called when a request fails with an error.
      Parameters:
      method - the JSON-RPC method name
      error - the error that occurred

    • onBackpressure

      @Deprecated(since="0.5.0", forRemoval=true) default void onBackpressure()
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      Use onBackpressure(int, int) instead for better debugging context
      Called when a request is rejected due to backpressure (too many in-flight requests).

    • onBackpressure

      default void onBackpressure(int pendingCount, int maxPendingRequests)
      Called when a request is rejected due to backpressure.

      This method provides context about the current queue state to help diagnose backpressure issues.

      Parameters:
      pendingCount - the current number of pending requests when backpressure triggered
      maxPendingRequests - the maximum number of pending requests allowed
      Since:
      0.5.0

    • onConnectionLost

      default void onConnectionLost()
      Called when the WebSocket connection is lost.

    • onReconnect

      default void onReconnect()
      Called when the WebSocket connection is re-established.

    • onSubscriptionNotification

      default void onSubscriptionNotification(String subscriptionId)
      Called when a subscription notification is received.
      Parameters:
      subscriptionId - the subscription ID

    • onRingBufferSaturation

      default void onRingBufferSaturation(long remainingCapacity, int bufferSize)
      Called when the Disruptor ring buffer is nearing saturation.

      This is triggered when the ring buffer's remaining capacity falls below a threshold (e.g., 10% remaining). This is a leading indicator of potential backpressure issues.

      Parameters:
      remainingCapacity - the number of slots remaining in the ring buffer
      bufferSize - the total ring buffer size

    • onOrphanedResponse

      default void onOrphanedResponse(String reason)
      Called when an orphaned response is received.

      An orphaned response is a response received with no matching pending request. This typically occurs when:

      • The response ID cannot be parsed
      • The request timed out before the response arrived
      • The request was cancelled

      High orphan counts may indicate network issues, server-side delays, or timeout values that are too aggressive.

      Parameters:
      reason - a description of why the response was orphaned (e.g., "no pending request", "unparseable ID")
      Since:
      0.5.0

    • onSubscriptionCallbackError

      default void onSubscriptionCallbackError(String subscriptionId, Throwable error)
      Called when a subscription callback throws an exception.

      This is triggered when user-provided subscription listeners throw an exception during notification processing. The exception is caught to prevent it from affecting other subscriptions or the WebSocket connection.

      Implementations should use this to:

      • Track error rates per subscription
      • Alert on misbehaving callbacks
      • Debug callback issues in production
      Parameters:
      subscriptionId - the subscription ID that encountered the error
      error - the exception thrown by the callback
      Since:
      0.5.0

    • noop

      static BraneMetrics noop()
      Returns a no-op metrics implementation that does nothing.
      Returns:
      a no-op BraneMetrics instance
